messages.subject: Re: Straw sandals (not zori)
messages.msgSnippet: Mr. Richardson and Mr. Polenghi, Many thanks.  That is exactly what I was looking for. Peace, Matt
messages.messageBody:
Mr. Richardson and Mr. Polenghi,

Many thanks. That is exactly what I was looking for.


Peace,

Matt

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Straw sandals (not zori)
messages.msgSnippet: HI They are called Waraji heres a pic http://www.shop-japan.co.jp/shop/jikatabi/waraji-wearing.gif and heres how you tie them on
messages.messageBody:
HI

They are called Waraji

heres a pic
http://www.shop-japan.co.jp/shop/jikatabi/waraji-wearing.gif

and heres how you tie them on
http://www.shop-japan.co.jp/shop/jikatabi/how-to-wear-waraji-illust.htm

Paul



--- "M. R. Williams" <amacobra@...> wrote:

---------------------------------
Greetings,

I would like to pick the brains of the knowledgable
members of this list.
I am trying to remember the name of the straw sandals
wore by the Japanese
that tie around the ankle and calf. They are usually
relatively thin. If
anyone could help me by naming this item and, if
possible, tell me where I
could acquire a pair I would be muchly obliged.


Peace,

Matt Williams

messages.subject: Straw sandals (not zori)
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings, I would like to pick the brains of the knowledgable members of this list. I am trying to remember the name of the straw sandals wore by the Japanese
messages.messageBody:
Greetings,

I would like to pick the brains of the knowledgable members of this list.
I am trying to remember the name of the straw sandals wore by the Japanese
that tie around the ankle and calf. They are usually relatively thin. If
anyone could help me by naming this item and, if possible, tell me where I
could acquire a pair I would be muchly obliged.


Peace,

Matt Williams
